question: Two opposite faces of a cube show numbers 1 and 6. The adjacent faces show 2, 3, and 5. Which number is opposite to 2?
If a cube has its surfaces colored in six different colors and is cut into 64 smaller cubes, how many of those will have exactly 3 colored faces?
A cube has numbers 1 to 6. Two adjacent faces show 1 and 3. Can 1 and 6 be adjacent?
Three different positions of a cube show these faces: 3, 2, 5; then 2, 6, 3; then 6, 1, 2. Which number is opposite 5?
If the faces of a cube are numbered such that sum of numbers on opposite faces is always 7, which pair is NOT possible?
A cube is painted on all sides and cut into 27 small cubes. How many cubes will have only one face painted?
Which of the following cannot be the net of a cube?
If opposite faces of a cube are painted the same color, and the cube is cut into 64 small cubes, how many have no painted face?
Three views of a cube show @, #, &, %, *, $. If % is opposite to @, and # is adjacent to *, then what is opposite to &?
How many corners does a cube have?
In a cube, if 4 faces meet at a point, how many such points does the cube have?
A cube is rolled four times to the left. How many faces have definitely changed positions?
If a cube has three faces showing X, Y, Z in clockwise order, and it is rotated to the right, which symbol comes to the top?
The cube has its bottom face with no color. When rotated without lifting, will the bottom face ever be visible?
A cube is painted blue on all faces and sliced into 216 equal cubes. How many cubes will have 2 faces painted?
